question: A trader buys 500 kg of cotton for ₹ 8,000. If 10% of this cotton gets damaged due to rain, at what rate (₹ / kg) should he sell the remaining cotton to earn a profit of 20%? https://appx-content-v2.classx.co.in/website/bulk_uploader_images/1751017808621_image001.png

A tank is filled by three pipes having different uniform flow rates. When the first two pipes work together, they fill the tank in the same time as the third pipe alone. The second pipe can fill the tank 5 hours faster than the first pipe, but 4 hours slower than the third pipe. How much time (in hours) will the first pipe take to fill the tank?
If one angle of a parallelogram is 28° less than three times its smallest angle, then find the measure of the largest angle of the parallelogram.
solution:
∠ A+ ∠ B+ ∠ C+ ∠ D=360° https://appx-content-v2.classx.co.in/website/bulk_uploader_images/1751017808621_image024.png x
= 3x – 28
∠ A= ∠ C ∠ B = ∠ D
x + x + 3x – 28 + 3x – 28 = 360°
8x = 360° + 56
x = 52
= 3×52–28 = 128°

question: The resistance of a wire is directly proportional to its length and inversely proportional to the square of its radius. Two wires of the same material have the same resistance and their radii are in the ratio of 7 : 8. The corresponding lengths of the wires are 147 cm and L cm respectively. Find the value of L.

Sapna completes a work in 12 hours while working alone. If Sapna and Riya working together at their respective fixed speeds complete the same work in 8 hours. Then in how many hours can Riya complete it while working alone?

S borrowed some amount from R and promised to pay him 8% interest. S then invested the borrowed amount in a scheme which earned a profit of 5% after paying R's principal along with interest. What percentage profit would R have earned if he had invested directly in such a scheme?

A certain sum of money becomes seven times of itself in 14 years when invested at a certain rate of simple interest. How much time (in years, rounded off to 2 decimal places) will it take to become 18 times of itself at the same rate of interest?

question: The sentence given below has spelling errors. Select the sentence without spelling errors. We can also contribute to presarvation of water bodies by not dumping our garbage in them.
option_1: We can also contribute to presarvation of water bodies by not dumpeing our garbage in them.
option_2: We can also contribute to preservation of water bodies by not dumping our garbage in them.
option_3: We can also contribut to presarvation of water bodies by not dumping our garbage in them.
option_4: We can also contribute to presarvation of water bodies by not dumping our garbag in them.
solution:
We can also contribute to preservation of water bodies by not dumping our garbage in them.
'Contribute', 'Preservation', 'Dumping' and 'Garbage' are correct spellings.

question: Select the most appropriate SYNONYM of the word given in Bold/Underline. Vagrancy
solution:
Vagabond - a person who has no home and wanders from place to place.
Vagrancy - the state of living as a vagrant or homeless.
Vagueness - the state of being unclear or inexact.
Fragrance - a pleasant smell.
Exploration - the activity of searching and finding out about something.

question: Select the correct indirect/direct form of the given sentence. "Oh, how could I ever thank you, Sir!" said the convict to the Bishop.
option_1: The convict told the Bishop that it was difficult for him to thank him.
option_2: Exclaiming gratefully, the convict said to the Bishop that he could never thank him enough.
option_3: The convict said to the Bishop that he could never thank him enough.
option_4: The convict exclaimed gratefully to the Bishop that how he could ever thank him.
solution:
Exclaiming gratefully, the convict said to the Bishop that he could never thank him enough. (Correct)
The convict told the Bishop that it was difficult for him to thank him.(sentence )
The convict said to the Bishop that he could never thank him enough.( Reporting Verb)
The convict exclaimed gratefully to the Bishop that how he could ever thank him. (sentence )

question: Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the word given in Bold/Underline. Raciness
solution:
Perfection - the state of being flawless or without any defects or faults.
Raciness - rude and showing no respect.
Filth - a dirty or corrupt condition.
Lewdness - behaviour that is sexually explicit, vulgar, or offensive.
Obscenity - something that is offensive, indecent, or morally unacceptable.

question: Select the INCORRECTLY spelt word.

solution:
Harmonious - in agreement or concord.
Concordant - being in agreement or harmony.
Unanimous - fully in agreement.
Abnormal - deviating from what is normal or usual.
Certain - known for sure.

question: Select the option that can be used as a one-word substitute for the given group of words. A big clumsy often slow-witted person
solution:

Chump - a foolish or easily deceived person.
Ape - an unintelligent or clumsy person.

question:
In the following passages, some words have been deleted. Read the passage carefully and select the most appropriate option to fill in each blank.
There is a new study on air pollution which comes from the experts of the World Health Organization (WHO) which is an agency of the United Nations. If you 1. _____ unhealthy air for long periods of time, you could 2. ____ sick. Air pollution has been linked to many diseases 3. _____stroke and cancer. The WHO says that seven million 4. _______die each year as a result of the 5. _____ air.
1.
solution:
Sentence unhealthy air inhale verb use Option (c) correct answer
Inhale : To take air, smoke, gas, etc. into your lungs as you breathe
Gulp : To swallow large amounts of food or drink quickly (Air )
Gasp : To take a quick deep breath with your mouth open, especially because you are surprised or in pain
Draw : To make pictures, or a picture of something, with a pencil, pen or chalk (but not paint)
